(46) 100.12th March, 1946.CABINET.MINISTERIAL COMMITTEES ON HOME AND overseas information SERVICES.Composition and Terms oe Reference.Note by the Prime Minister.AT their meeting on the 18th February (CM. (46) 16th Conclusions,Minute 8), the Cabinet approved the establishment of Ministerial Committees on home and Overseas Information Services on the lines recommended in the reportof the Official Committee on Government Information Services annexed to cp. (46) 54.2. Chairman. I have asked the Lord President of the Council to be Chair-man of the two Committees. He will assist the Postmaster-General in debates on general broadcasting policy in accordance with the Cabinets decision of the21st February (CM. (46) 17th Conclusions, Minute 4).3. Committee on Home Information Services. The terms of reference ofthe Ministerial Committee on Home Information Services will be " To keep under review problems of Government information policy andthe working of Government information services within the United Kingdomand to consider such other related problems as may be referred to them by theCabinet." For these purposes to meet jointly with the Overseas information services (Ministerial) Committee whenever convenient."and the composition of the Committee will be :; Lord President of the Council (Chairman).Chancellor of the Exchequer.President of the Board of Trade.Secretary of State for Air.Secretary of State for Scotland.Minister of Fuel and Power.Minister of Labour and National Service.Minister of Education.Minister of Health.Minister of Food.Postmaster-General.The composition of the Committee may be varied from time to time, as maybe necessary to ensure that it contains the Ministers whose Departments are mostheavily engaged in Departmental publicity and others who have special knowledgeof publicity matters.4. Committee on Overseas Information Services. The terms of reference of the Ministerial Committee on Overseas Information Services will be : "To keep under review problems of British Government informationpolicy and the working of British Government information services overseas,and to consider such other related problems as may be referred to them bythe Cabinet.[31433]Printed for the Cabinet. March 1946. " For these purposes to meet jointly with the Home Information Services(Ministerial) Committee whenever convenient."and the composition of the Committee will be : Lord President of the Council (Chairman).Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs.Chancellor of the Exchequer.President of the Board of Trade.First Lord of the Admiralty.Secretary of State for Dominion Affairs.Secretary of State for India and Burma.Secretary of State for the Colonies.The Foreign Secretary will normally be represented by the parliamentary under-Secretary of State, who is to act as Chairman of the Official overseas information Committee.C. R. A.10 Downing Street, S.W. 1,12th March, 1946.
